intro: Dicraeopetalum stipulare, commonly known as the stipulate dicraeopetalum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive stipules, which are leaf-like structures at the base of the petioles. The plant typically produces showy, pentagonal flowers with five petals that are often brightly colored. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
